clinical_validity.disease_label: combined immunodeficiency due to OX40 deficiency

BP.term: positive regulation of B cell proliferation
negative regulation of DNA-binding transcription factor activity

name: TNF receptor superfamily member 4
other_names: tumor necrosis factor receptor superfamily member 4

pid.name: Downstream signaling in naïve CD8+ T cells

summary: The protein encoded by this gene is a member of the TNF-receptor superfamily. This receptor has been shown to activate NF-kappaB through its interaction with adaptor proteins TRAF2 and TRAF5. Knockout studies in mice suggested that this receptor promotes the expression of apoptosis inhibitors BCL2 and BCL2lL1/BCL2-XL, and thus suppresses apoptosis. The knockout studies also suggested the roles of this receptor in CD4+ T cell response, as well as in T cell-dependent B cell proliferation and differentiation. [provided by RefSeq, Jul 2008].
